summary.para: Finds the that represents the same primary key property as the given property, but potentially in a shared root table.
This type is typically used by database providers (and other extensions). It is generally not used in application code.

Docs.returns: The property found, or null if none was found.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsColumnNullable (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IProperty property);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsColumnNullable(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IProperty property) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function IsColumnNullable (property As IProperty) As Boolean
static member IsColumnNullable : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IProperty -> bool

summary.para: Checks whether or not the column mapped to the given will be nullable or not when created in the database.
This can depend not just on the property itself, but also how it is mapped. For example, non-nullable properties in a TPH type hierarchy will be mapped to nullable columns.

Docs.returns: True if the mapped column is nullable; false otherwise.
